title: Removal of old trie logs specified by historical block limit

labels.name: TeamGroot
labels.description: GH issues worked on by Groot Team

body:
There is no need to keep all the trie logs for a near-head node as the state for old blocks is rarely needed. This will place a configurable limit on how many trie logs are kept reducing storage needed for a node.

* Add configurable limit for number trie logs to be kept. This should be the same as the Bonsai read limit config 
--bonsai-maximum-back-layers-to-load parameter
* Prune old trie logs that are not needed
* Trie logs are stored by block hash so there will need to be a way of determining with block hashes to remove the trie logs for
* The logic used for the block pruning which keeps a list of block hashes for each block number could possibly be reused for pruning the trie log
* This should be enabled independently of the chain data pruning feature and can be used together
* Measure storage saved by having the trie log pruning enabled
* Test that reorgs have their trie log pruned

Acceptance Criteria
* DB size of long running node should be the same before and after resync

Notes:
* The `ChainDataPruner` could be a helpful place to start and reuse some of the same logic

Tasks:
- [x] First iteration of `--Xbonsai-trie-log-pruning-enabled`: https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/6026 
- [x] Consider using safeBlock instead of 512 layers to retain
  - would be a nice strategy to prune only blocks older than RETAINED_LAYERS that have a subsequent finalized blockhash
- [x] Consider belts and braces protection during rollback/forward in case pruned trielog may be in use
  - not sure how useful this is now we only prune finalized blocks
- [ ] DB size of long running node should be the same before and after resync - 
  - [x]  without flat db https://gist.github.com/siladu/0a6fe37fe6de350cef233136e237a6e4
  - [ ] with flat db - underway with `simon-flatdb*`
- [ ] Measure storage saved by having the trie log pruning enabled - underway on `*simon-6026*` and `*simon-flatdb*` nodes
     ```
       0 16 * * * echo "\n\n=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=\n$(date)\n" >> /home/simon.dudley/rocksdb-usage.txt 2>&1
       1 16 * * * time /opt/besu/6000/bin/besu --config-file=/etc/besu/config.toml operator x-rocksdb usage >> /home/simon.dudley/rocksdb-usage.txt 2>&1
     ```
   - 2 week old TRIE_LOG_STORAGE saving is 6GB = 3GB per week
   - 7 week old TRIE_LOG_STORAGE saving is 22GB = 3.14GB per week
- [ ] Optimisation 1: Move pruning to async thread
  - https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/6026#issuecomment-1814774736
- [ ] Subcommand to one-off prune the backlog, see https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/6000
- [ ] Reorg acceptance test
- [ ] Reuse `--bonsai-historical-block-limit` instead of `--Xbonsai-trie-log-retention-threshold`
  - These two options are incompatible due to retention-threshold having a *minimum* value of 512, so we either need to make a breaking change to introduce a minimum value or bonsai-historical-block-limit, or remove the minimum value constraint from the pruning logic.
- [ ] Rename `--Xbonsai-trie-log-pruning-enabled` to `--Xbonsai-limit-trie-logs-enabled`?
- [ ] Prevent block building from saving orphaned trie logs 
- [ ] Consider an option to only prune forks
- [ ] Optimisation 2: Prune in batches?
- [ ] Optimisation 3: Cache finalizedBlockHeader in Blockchain or use Observer pattern to pass it to the pruner

* Are we also saving trie logs when block building? 
Yes...see code path starting here https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/1c261db30f5cb9504e86b6b24eb99502d17b6336/consensus/merge/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/consensus/merge/blockcreation/MergeCoordinator.java#L546
